Instruction:
Task Description: Create a Java class that implements an HTTP media streaming server capable of serving files over a local network connection using TCP sockets.

Class Description: The HttpMediaStreamer class provides functionality to stream media files over HTTP protocol. It creates a local server socket, handles incoming client connections, and streams the requested file with proper HTTP headers. The class manages the server lifecycle and provides access to the streaming URI.

Attributes:
- uri: Uri - The URI pointing to the local HTTP streaming endpoint
- serverSocket: ServerSocket - The server socket instance used for listening to client connections
- TAG: String - Constant for logging purposes (class name)

Methods:
- HttpMediaStreamer(String filename, String mimeType) -> [Constructor] - Initializes the streamer with the file to serve and its MIME type
- getUri() -> Uri - Returns the streaming URI for the hosted file
- destroy() -> void - Closes the server socket and cleans up resources
- create(String filename, String mimeType) -> Uri - Internal method that sets up the server socket and starts the streaming thread
